Detailed Description

Flash object to be included in a post to a user's stream.

Create an flash media object, fill in the object's fields, and add the object to the JRActivityObject.media array in your JRActivityObject. How the flash videos get presented and whether or not they are used, depend on the provider.

Each video must contain an NSString* swfsrc url, which is the URL of the Flash object to be rendered, and an NSString* imgsrc, which is the URL of an photo that should be displayed in place of the flash object until the user clicks to prompt the flash object to play. Both URLs must be well-formed; that is, they must have both a scheme and host, and conform to RFC 2396. Flash objects have two optional fields, width and height, which can be used to override the default choices when displaying the video in the provider's stream (e.g., Facebook's stream). They also have two optional fields, expanded_width and expanded_height, to specify the width and height of flash object will resize to, on the provider's stream, once the user clicks on it.

Note:
You can only include one JRFlashMediaObject in the media array. Any others will be ignored.
See also:
Format and rules are identical to those described on the Facebook Developer page on Attachments.

Member Function Documentation

- (id) initWithSwfsrc: (NSString *)  swfsrc
andImgsrc: (NSString *)  imgsrc 

Returns a JRFlashMediaObject initialized with the given swfsrc and imgsrc.

Parameters:
swfsrc The URL of the Flash object to be rendered. This value must be an NSString* representation of a well-formed URL, with a scheme and host. It cannot be an empty string or nil
imgsrc The URL of an photo that should be displayed in place of the flash object. This value must be an NSString* representation of a well-formed URL, with a scheme and host. It cannot be an empty string or nil
Returns:
A JRFlashMediaObject initialized with the given swfsrc and imgsrc. If either swfsrc or imgsrc are malformed, empty, or nil, returns nil

Properties

- (NSString*) swfsrc [read, assign]

The URL of the Flash object to be rendered.

- (NSString*) imgsrc [read, assign]

The URL of an photo that should be displayed in place of the flash object.

- (NSUInteger) width [read, write, assign]

Used to override the default width.

- (NSUInteger) height [read, write, assign]

Used to override the default height.

- (NSUInteger) expanded_width [read, write, assign]

Width the video will resize to once the user clicks it.

- (NSUInteger) expanded_height [read, write, assign]

Height the video will resize to once the user clicks it.
